channel.title: Can't run any 614 source or ANY compiler
channel.description:
It's been about 3 years since I coded my last server (317) and I really want to start making more. But recently I've tryed EVERY 614 source on this website and not one has worked for me. Not only that but the compilers for everything also give me errors. I use Windows 7. This happens sometimes aswell
[IMG]http://i55.tinypic.com/35ddaad.jpg[/img]
Can anyone please help?
Note: I have already looked at the known compiler errors and my 'cannot find the path specified error' isn't on there.

item.title: Can't run any 614 source or ANY compiler
item.dc:creator: @Mumups1 Mumups_
item.description:
@Mumups1 wrote:

Heheh I used to have this error all the time on my old XP, All i had to do is change javac to “C:\Program Files\Java\jdk1.6.0_14\bin\javac.exe”

(replace the jdk version ofc)

EDIT: for w7 i think you add (x86) after program files

Read full topic

item.source: Can't run any 614 source or ANY compiler

item.title: Can't run any 614 source or ANY compiler
item.dc:creator: @Liquid_Magic Liquid Magic
item.description:
@Liquid_Magic wrote:

it doesn’t recognize the javac command. make sure you have the JDK and your system’s environmental variables are set.

JDK: http://www.oracle.com/technetwork/java/javase/downloads/index.html
Tutorial: http://www.moparisthebest.com/smf/index.php/topic,342685.0.html

Ripped from the above topic:


Setting up your Environmental Variables


Environmental variables are what allows you to run your server with Java, without it you would simple get 'The path is not yet specified' so this is an extremely important step. We will firstly open 'My Computer' and click 'View System Information'. As you do this, a small applet displaying several tabs, and you will select the one that says 'Advanced' and at the bottom, click 'Environmental Variables'. Now what you're going to do, is go to your 'Path' and 'Classpath' variables and edit them.

In your Classpath variable, you're going to take everything currently inside it and edit it with your latest version of JDK, so right now it would be;

Code: [Select]
CLASSPATH=C:\Program Files\Java\jdk1.6.0_11\bin;%CLASSPATH%;
Though if a newer version comes out, you would change the 'jdk1.6.0_11' to the newest version.


After you have done the Classpath variable, you're going to find the Path variable and add the code below inside it.

Code: [Select]
C:\Program Files\Java\jdk1.6.0_11\bin;
The same goes for Path, if you download a newer version of JDK then you're going to change the 'jdk1.6.0_11' to your current version.

Read full topic
